enWisdom: Insinuation is the severest punishment for the intelligent one

Wisdom: افْرَحْ بِمَا تَنْطِقُ بِهِ إِذَا كَانَ عَرْياً مِنَ الْخَطَإِ
enWisdom: Be pleased with what you say if it is free from mistakes

Wisdom: أَحْضَرُ النَّاسِ جَوَاباً مَنْ لَمْ يَغْضَبْ
enWisdom: The person most prepared to [give a] reply is one who does not get angry

Wisdom: إِنَّ مِنَ الْعِبَادَةِ لِينَ الْكَلَامِ وَإِفْشَاءَ السَّلَامِ
enWisdom: Verily polite speech and the propagation of peace are forms of worship

Wisdom: عَوِّدْ أُذُنَكَ حُسْنَ الِاسْتِمَاعِ وَلَا تَصْغِ إِلَى مَا لَا يَزِيدُ فِي صَلَاحِكَ اسْتِمَاعُهُ فَإِنَّ ذَلِكَ يُصْدِي الْقُلُوبَ وَيُوجِبُ الْمَذَامَّ
enWisdom: Train your ears to listen well and do not pay attention to that which does not increase anything useful for you by listening to it, for verily this corrodes the hearts and leads to dispraise
For every statement there is a reply
The tongue of the neglectful is short
One who insists [too much] makes others fed up of him

Wisdom: مَنْ سَأَلَ فَوْقَ قَدْرِهِ اسْتَحَقَّ الْحِرْمَانَ
enWisdom: One who asks for that which is above his rank deserves to be deprived

Wisdom: مَنْ أَسْرَعَ فِي الْجَوَابِ لَمْ يُدْرِكِ الصَّوَابَ
enWisdom: One who hastens to reply does not arrive at the right [answer]
Do not argue with a vile person for he will be bold [and disrespectful] with you

Wisdom: لَا تُعَوِّدْ نَفْسَكَ الْيَمِينَ فَإِنَّ الحَلَّافَ لَا يَسْلَمُ مِنَ الْإِثْمِ
enWisdom: Do not habituate yourself to taking oaths, for verily the one who swears excessively is not safe from sin
